meanings.definition: The state of being thick, sticky, and semifluid in consistency.
meanings.sent1: The viscosity of the honey made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent2: The viscosity of the mud caused the wheels to get stuck.
meanings.sent3: The viscosity of the slime made it a challenge to clean up.
meanings.sent4: The viscosity of the glue held the pieces together tightly.
meanings.sent5: The viscosity of the syrup made it flow slowly like molasses.

meanings.definition: The property of a fluid that resists the force tending to cause the fluid to flow.
meanings.sent1: The high viscosity of the oil prevented it from spilling easily.
meanings.sent2: The low viscosity of water allows it to flow freely.
meanings.sent3: The viscosity of the shampoo made it hard to squeeze out of the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The viscosity of the lava created a slow-moving river of molten rock.
meanings.sent5: The viscosity of the paint affected how smoothly it spread on the canvas.
